intro: Taeniophyllum papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan star moss, is a unique liverwort species native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, closely packed leaves that are typically green or reddish in color, depending on environmental conditions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or on rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
